CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 15, 1956, pg. 2, reads: "Cephus' Checker Club Gives $$$ to NAACP - Happy Checker Players - Happily, members of Cephus Ford's Checker Club sift through the 'spill' of about $1,200 in coins which they donated to the NAACP and Crippled Children's Fund. The scene occurred shortly after Mr. Ford hammered open the safe's door last Tuesday evening at the club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of Checkers Club, and Bishop Charles H. Foggie fourth from left, gathered around opened safe with change spilling onto floor, for NAACP and crippled children benefit
